Pre-Game Insights: Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni expressed concern about safety ahead of the Copa America final, citing the recent brawl between Uruguay and Colombia fans.
Argentina goalkeeper Emiliano Mart√≠nez called for the tournament to'reinforce security' for the final.
Colombia midfielder Juan Quintero expressed similar concern, stating that they hope the incident will not happen again during the match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Copa America final between Argentina and Colombia is expected to draw over 65,000 people, with resale tickets ranging from a couple thousand dollars to upward of $10,000.
The match will be the 44th meeting between the two teams.
Others: CONMEBOL, South American soccer's governing body, condemned the violence in a news release and stated that 'any action that tarnishes a global football celebration will not be tolerated.'
